user.biography: We are a purpose-driven business on a mission to end the ocean plastic crisis. Over 16 million pounds of trash removed!

node.text:
Check out where we take the trash recovered by our captains and crews in Guatemala! 

Over the last couple weeks, we’ve explored the causes of plastic pollution in Guatemala and shared our strategy for addressing the ocean plastic crisis in this region. Now, we’re taking you behind the scenes of our main operational base in Puerto Barrios, which is the first stop for the trash our crews recover from the ocean.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Visit the link in our bio to learn more about where we take our recovered trash in Guatemala! 🇬🇹

node.text:
Are you obsessed with the clean ocean movement? Do you brag about our mission to all your friends? Are you taking steps to reduce your plastic footprint? Do you encourage others to reduce theirs? ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
If you answered “Yes!” this is your chance to become a 4ocean Brand Ambassador and earn cash doing what you already do! ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
We're beyond stoked to launch this brand new program that gives YOU the opportunity to grow the clean ocean movement, and earn awesome rewards while doing so. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Click the link in our bio to learn more about the 4ocean Brand Ambassador Program and submit your application 📲⁠⁠
⁠⁠
#4ocean #brandambassador #brand #oceanplastic #plasticpollution #breakfreefromplastic #saveourseas

node.text:
We are honored to join over 550 organizations and advocates encouraging the next presidential administration to take immediate action on plastic pollution through executive action.

We need a #PlasticFreePresident to lead us on the pathway to a plastic free future! 

Visit the link in our bio to learn about the Plastic Free President Action Plan, get involved by signing the petition, and represent the clean ocean movement!

#breakfreefromplastic #plasticpollution #4ocean #oceanplastic

node.text:
We know that cleaning the ocean and empowering individuals to use alternative products is not enough to stop plastic pollution. We must take bold steps to advocate for policy change that will hold brands, manufacturers, and the plastics industry accountable for their significant contributions to the ocean plastic crisis.

We are proud to support the Break Free From Plastic Pollution Act and are calling on every member of the clean ocean movement to join us. The Break Free From Plastic Pollution Act is a comprehensive piece of federal legislation in the U.S. that provides a comprehensive approach to reducing plastic pollution. 
To find out how you can get involved, visit 4ocean.com/breakfree today!

node.title: The Break Free From Plastic Pollution Act needs our support!

node.text:
Having ongoing support from people in all industries is imperative to the success of the clean ocean movement. Thank you so much to every single person and group who has shared our story with their followers, friends and families over the years.

Today has been remarkable!  So many of you have pledged to live an ocean friendly lifestyle, signed petitions, shared content, spoke from your hearts, and even pulled pounds.

We appreciate each and every one of you and look forward to fighting for a cleaner ocean with you for many years to come. Onward!

#4ocean #WorldOceansDay #BreakFreeFromPlastic #PlasticFree #OceanCleanup #PlasticPollution #UNWorldOceansDay #Environment #Ocean

node.text: Dr. Peter Kershaw joins @4ocean cofounder Alex Schulze ahead of @unworldoceansday this Monday June 8th to discuss plastic pollution and innovative solutions. To learn how you can play your part in mitigating the impact of plastic pollution, join us at the event via UNWorldOceansDay.org/2020!

node.text:
One question we’re often asked is “What do you do with all the trash you collect?” So we took a trip to our headquarters in Haiti to show you what happens next. 
Turn up your volume and follow along to find out more!

node.text:
We’re partnering with Safe Harbor for cleaner marinas across the country.

Ever since we introduced the 4ocean Harbor Skimmer, it’s been our 
dream to see it used in harbors and marinas around the world. 
Well, today, we’re stoked to announce that our dream is coming true!

Safe Harbor Marinas, the world’s largest owner and operator of marinas, has agreed to install 4ocean Harbor Skimmers in several of their locations across the country.

Our partnership will begin with a pilot program in Florida before ultimately expanding nationwide — a deployment that would likely involve more than 97 locations.

This is HUGE news and would not be possible without the support of our clean ocean movement and people like you! Every time you purchase a 4ocean product, it helps fund the removal of marine debris from the ocean and supports our efforts to develop and install clean ocean technologies around the world.

node.text:
Project Guatemala Update: You keep asking in the comments to see more of the OPR vessel. Take a tour and see it from the inside. 
The OPR Vessel will allow us to clean the ocean and coastlines more efficiently in Central America. 
Let us know in the comments what you want to see next. 👀 
#4ocean #WeAre4ocean #ProjectGuatemala

node.text:
Project Guatemala Update: You’ve been following us along as we’ve introduced the next challenge our 4ocean Cleanup Crews will face. Now we want to take you on tour of our HQ in Guatemala where we’ll be setting up operations that will allow us to clean the ocean and coastlines in Central America. 
Stay tuned for the next update. 
#4ocean #WeAre4ocean #ProjectGuatemala

node.text:
We're excited to announce Project Guatemala!
Starting this month, 4ocean is expanding our cleanup operations into Central America where we will take on the Rio Motagua and the ever-elusive Trash Islands. This is going to be our greatest challenge yet and we need your help!
Head over to the link in our bio to pull a pound today.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 4ocean on July 23, 2021. May be an image of body of water.

node.text:
Before ➡️ After

Team Haiti absolutely crushed this cleanup mission! Earlier this month, they recovered over 1,700 pounds of trash, most of which was single-use plastic, from this coastline off Archaie. 

Their hard work and dedication is one of the many reasons why we were recently able to sail past our goal of 16 MILLION pounds of trash recovered from the ocean, rivers, and coastlines to date!

Now, it's crunch time as we try to reach our next goal of 20 million pounds of trash. You can help us get there by pulling a pound yourself at 4ocean.com 🌊 

#4ocean #plasticpollution #oceancleanup #beachcleanup #saveourseas #marineconservation

node.text:
Microplastics are invading our planet! 👽🛸 

Researchers have documented microplastic particles in “pristine” environments all over the world, from the remote French Pyrenees to the Arctic to the farmland soil of China. On top of that, it's estimated that there are 51 TRILLION pieces of microplastic floating in the ocean right NOW.

Since microplastics are typically pieces of plastic that have broken off larger plastic items, one of the best ways to fight this invasion is by refusing single-use plastic and opting for sustainable alternatives in your daily routine, especially this #PlasticFreeJuly

Microplastics can also come from beauty products, car tires, and even the clothes you wear.

To learn more about microplastics and how you can combat the plastic pollution problem, visit the link in our bio and read our blog post!

node.text:
Our partnership with @SustainableCoastlinesHawaii is having an EPIC impact!

For every Hawksbill Sea Turtle Bracelet sold, we'll donate $1 to Sustainable Coastlines Hawaii who will use our donation to keep Hawaii’s marine habitats free from fishing nets and other harmful marine debris.

The Marine Debris Rapid Response Program allows crews to immediately respond to reports of harmful debris like ghost nets, microplastics, and other large debris accumulations on the islands.

By removing these hazardous threats from the environment as soon as they’re reported, we can prevent needless injuries and deaths not just for hawksbill sea turtles, but for all the animals that call these waters home.

To learn more about the impact our partnership with Sustainable Coastlines Hawaii will have, visit the link in our bio!

node.text:
Back by popular demand: 4ocean x Cariuma Sneakers 👟 

We heard you loud and clear! We’re stoked to announce that we’re bringing back our limited edition 4ocean x @Cariuma Sneakers so you can continue to spread awareness and rep the clean ocean movement in style.

4ocean x Cariuma Sneakers are only manufactured once you place your order, which is just one of the reasons why they’re so ocean-friendly. On top of that, each pair ordered will fund the removal of 2 pounds of trash from our oceans and coastlines.

Choose between two styles — IBI Low Tops or IBI Slip-Ons — in white or 4ocean blue!

Visit the link in our bio to snag yours today before pre-orders close! 

#4ocean #oceanplastic #vegan #sneakers #sneakerhead #sneaker #sneakernews

node.text:
WIN AN ALL-EXPENSES-PAID TRIP TO OAHU, HAWAII ✈️🌺 

We're giving one lucky member of the clean ocean movement the chance to fly to Hawaii and explore the incredible island, snorkel with sharks, join a beach cleanup, explore the fascinating world of marine debris research, meet local Hawaiian activists and more!

This all-expenses-paid trip will give you tons of unique opportunities to get involved with our local partners in Hawaii and connect with the ocean we’re all working so hard to protect. 🌊 

TO ENTER, click the link in our bio and fill out the form.

You have from now until September 29th to enter to win this opportunity of a lifetime, so hurry up because time is running out ⏳

Tag the friend you would bring with you in the comments below!

#4ocean #hawaii #sweepstakes #contest #giveaway #win

node.text:
There is an endless stream of single-use plastic washing up on Guatemala’s coast right now. This situation is real. 

Let this be a reminder of how important it is to refuse single-use plastic and help us stop plastic pollution at the its source. #4ocean #plasticpollution

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 4ocean on July 18, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and jewelry.

node.text:
Our best-selling Sterling Silver Necklace is almost out of stock ⏳ 

Made with 4ocean Plastic that our crews recovered directly from the beaches of Oahu, Hawaii, our necklaces not only look good, they do good.. for the ocean 🌊 

In addition to pulling one pound of trash from the ocean, rivers, and coastlines, your purchase will help fund a new 4ocean cleanup division in Hawaii!

As it's estimated that 15-20 tons of plastic trash washes ashore annually on a 0.6-mile uninhabited stretch of Hawaii’s Kamilo Beach, it's imperative that we explore cleanup efforts and the effects of plastic pollution there.

So help 4ocean get to Hawaii and order your Sterling Silver Necklace now at the link in our bio or you'll have to wait for the restock later this year!

node.text:
Mounds of plastic are piling up on the coast of Guatemala!

What's happening here?

➡️ In Guatemala, there’s just one official basurero (landfill) for the entire country in the nation’s capital of Guatemala City. Over a third of the country’s total trash ends up in the Guatemala City basurero each year, but not all of it stays there.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
During the rainy season, trash from the city’s basurero gets washed into the Rio Motagua - Guatemala’s longest river that runs about 300 miles from the remote central highlands to the Gulf of Honduras in the Caribbean.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
The trash that enters the Motagua pours out of the river into the Gulf Of Honduras, where ocean currents deposit it back onto Guatemala’s coast.

This situation is real. Recent heavy inland rains are creating this endless stream of plastic pollution and our Guatemala cleanup crews have been hard at work cleaning it up, while we've been simultaneously exploring locations in the river to install a boom system to stop trash before it ever reaches the ocean.

You can help them by pulling a pound at 4ocean.com today. 

#4ocean #plasticpollution #oceancleanup #beachcleanup #plasticpollution #saveourseas

node.text:
WE HIT 16 MILLION POUNDS!

Yep, you read that right. 16 MILLION POUNDS of trash recovered from the ocean, rivers, and coastlines by our cleanup crews around the world since 2017 🌏 

This achievement wouldn't be possible without the entire clean ocean movement on our side! Every pound you pull and every person you talk about our mission to makes a HUGE difference in this journey to ending the ocean plastic crisis.

Thank you all, from the bottom of our hearts. Now let's get to 20 million pounds!

Drop a 'Yewwww!' for our cleanup crews in the comments below ⬇️

node.text:
Calling all shark lovers.. IT'S SHARK AWARENESS DAY 🦈 

Shark Week & Shark Awareness Day are all about changing the world’s attitude toward sharks, which is why we chose the whale shark as our ambassador species. Despite their enormous size, these gentle giants are actually filter feeders that strain plankton, fish larvae, and other small prey from the water. 

Whale sharks aren’t harmful to humans, but human activities like pollution and overfishing are their biggest threats. In just 75 years, we’ve lost over half of our global whale shark population.

This week only, we’ll send you a FREE Whale Shark Bracelet with any 4ocean bracelet purchase so you can help us change minds and save sharks. 

Get yours and start celebrating sharks at 4ocean.com! 

#4ocean #sharkweek #sharkawarenessday #sharks #sharkwatch #shark

node.text:
Team Florida has been working hard to pull pounds lately!

Last week, we checked in on Team Florida to find that they've been working hard to clean up the trash left behind by Fourth of July celebrations within the Boca Raton Intracoastal.

On July 6th, our Florida cleanup crews visited Lake Wyman Park, which rests within the Boca Raton intracoastal. During this mission they collected a lot of "party trash" such as single-use plastic and empty alcohol bottles.

While we love a good celebration, we don't love when the ocean is polluted. Please consider using sustainable alternatives to single-use plastic, and of course never leave your trash behind. 

Visit the link in our bio to shop our collection of single-use alternatives today!
